text:
I have created a Ldap test which do a search request forever. After 115646
requests, I get Out of Memory messages :
2005/08/28 03:12:34 INFO  - jmeter.engine.StandardJMeterEngine: Starting 8
threads for group Thread Group. Ramp up = 10.
... (115646 search requests)
2005/08/28 04:43:25 ERROR - jmeter.threads.JMeterThread: Test failed!
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
... (Many OutOfMemory errors)
creator: elecharny@apache.org
elecharny@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 16228
The JMX file I used to do the test

This test is used to bench ApacheDS project. It should work without any
configuration against a standard Apache directory server freshly downloaded and
installed, as it just fetch the standard ldap content. I just changed the
listening port (from 389 to 10389)

This is probably failing because of the Listeners, not the LDap sampler.

The Aggregate Report (for example) needs to keep a copy of every sample time in
order to calculate the Median and 90% lines.

There's not a lot we can do about that, unfortunately.
